_header: For thou art comen of good blood
Subjects: sermons, verse in; money, use of
_description: A song of Freedom incorporated into a sermon by Nicholas Philip — three quatrains

BodLatTheD1.First Lines:
ffor þou art comen of good bloodor for art a riche man of
                    good…
BodLatTheD1.Last Lines:
…for but þou spendyte well er þou hooþi song
                    for euer is well ay woe
BodLatTheD1.Editions:
Pfander,  Homer Garrison. 
             “The Popular Sermon of the Medieval Friar in England.” 
         Diss. New York University, 1937: 49.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Historical Poems of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         New York: Columbia UP, 1959: 62.
